newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Multi-Code Electronics debuts at 8.0 rgt.
newsitem.headline: Multi-Code Electronics debuts at 8.0 rgt.

text.p: Multi-Code Electronics Bhd made its debut on the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange (KLSE) at 8.0 ringgit a share against its offer price of 3.8 ringgit.
The automotive components maker made an offer for sale of 16 million shares and a public issue of two million shares as part of the listing exercise.
After the first 15 minutes, the share dropped to 7.45 ringgit.
The company has forecast that its net profit in 1997 would be 11.88 million ringgit and rise to 15.23 million in 1998, against 11.55 million in 1996. Its year ends on July 31.
The net earnings per share for 1997 works out to 29.7 cents against 30 cents last year.
The share's price-earnings ratio based on the listing price works out to 12.79 for the current year. On its debut price of 8.0 ringgit the P/E ratio works out to 27 times.
